required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: TeleDiet Study: The Impact of Dietary Education and Counseling With a Smartphone Application on Secondary Prevention of Coronary Artery Disease
clinical_study.official_title: TeleDiet Study: A Randomized Controlled Study Investigating the Impact of Dietary Education and Counseling With a Smartphone Application on Secondary Prevention of Coronary Artery Disease

brief_summary.textblock:
Digital cardiology is gaining power in the field of preventive cardiology recently, and several trials have already shown good results of dietary therapy with digital cardiology. However, there has been no reports that showed effect of dietary counseling through digital cardiology for secondary prevention of coronary artery disease.
TeleDiet study investigates the impact of dietary therapy with a smartphone application on the content of meals and metabolic parameters for patients with coronary artery disease.

primary_outcome.description: This score has the extreme values of 0 (minimum) and 55 (maximum). Higher scores mean a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood lipid tests (LDL-cholesterol [LDL-C], HDL-cholesterol [HDL-C], and triglyceride [TG])
Parameters in the ergospirometer test (maximal oxygen consumption [VO2 max])
Parameters in the ergospirometer test (anaerobic threshold [AT])
Values of self-efficacy (questionnaire of General Self-Efficacy Scale [GSE])
secondary_outcome.description: This scale has the extreme values of 10 (minimum) and 40 (maximum). Higher scores mean a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Values of medication adherence (questionnaire of Identification of Medication Adherence Barriers [IMAB])
secondary_outcome.description: This scale has the extreme values of 30 (minimum) and 150 (maximum). Higher scores mean a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Values of quality of life (Health-related Quality of Life questionnaire [HeartQoL])
secondary_outcome.description: This scale has the extreme values of 0 (minimum) and 42 (maximum). Higher scores mean a better outcome.
Weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m^2.

intervention.description: Smartphone application named "Signal", which connects patients and health providers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Owning a smartphone and able to use it
2. Written informed consent obtained
3. Starting cardiac rehabilitation
4. Coronary artery disease
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Special diet due to other reasons (eg. renal diet, pancreatic insufficiency diet)
2. Age <18 years old
3. Pregnancy
